sentences.sContent: Many shops have raised their prices.
The university is working to raise the number of students from state schools.
sentences.sCn: 这所大学正在努力增加公立学校学生的入学人数。

sentences.sContent: a campaign to raise awareness of meningitis
sentences.sCn: 增强脑膜炎防治意识的活动

sentences.sContent: Dr Hayward intends to raise the museum’s profile (= make it more well-known ) .
sentences.sCn: 海沃德博士想提高博物馆的知名度。

sentences.sContent: The Trust hopes to raise 1 million to buy land.
sentences.sCn: 这家信托机构希望能筹集到一百万美元购置土地。

sentences.sContent: He raised cattle in Nebraska when he was young.
sentences.sCn: 他年轻时在内布拉斯加州养过牛。

phrases.pCn:
加剧敌对情绪;加剧紧张气氛:

The chairman's speech raised the temperature of the meeting.
主席的发言使会议的气氛顿时紧张起来。[见temperature]

words.tran: 提高（raise的过去时和过去分词）；举起

remMethod.val: 即使把头抬高(raise)也看不到上涨(rise)的房价

trans.tranOther: to increase an amount, number, or level
